paper.title: SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccines sensitize tumours to immune checkpoint blockade

core_question: Can intratumoral delivery of SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccines create an interferon-rich inflammatory state that improves sensitivity to anti-PD-L1 immune checkpoint therapy in cancer patients?

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Mouse efficacy cohort (combination therapy)
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: 78 tumor-bearing mice pooled across repeat experiments
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Preclinical mouse models receiving intratumoral mRNA vaccine combined with anti-PD-L1 therapy to assess tumor control efficacy.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Mouse control cohort
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: 84 tumor-bearing mice pooled across matched controls
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Matched control groups including vaccine-only, ICI-only, and vehicle treatment arms to establish baseline effects.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Human metastatic cohort (total)
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Retrospective cohort of metastatic cancer patients receiving immune checkpoint inhibitor treatment, analyzed by vaccination status.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Human vaccinated subgroup
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Subset of patients from the metastatic cohort who had prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination before ICI treatment.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Human unvaccinated subgroup
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Subset of patients from the metastatic cohort who did not receive SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination before ICI treatment.

major_limitations: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely and prevents definitive causal conclusions.
Vaccination timing relative to ICI initiation varied across patients, introducing heterogeneity that may affect outcome comparisons.
Tumor-type mix and treatment-history heterogeneity across the patient cohort limit direct causal interpretation of results.
Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors due to species differences in immune biology.
Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.
